data.title: First package dev journal
data.body:
This isn't an issue per se, more of a discussion starter. Over the holiday I spent a little time working on a package for generating theme screenshots for atom.io. There wasn't really anyone around on Campfire, so I thought I'd just dig through the docs and code and record my experience as a new package creator. The following is a journal of the early phase of my attempt at writing a package - a lot of the questions I ask were answered later / I worked out, but I thought it might be interesting to share.

---

My first reaction is "oh dear, spacepen uses a HAML-esque markup system". This is a personal preference, obviously, not a defect.

The "first package" docs mention changing the name of the command from toggle to something else in the view.coffee, but :toggle appears several other places in the generated code

After a little experimentation, it seems the minimum acceptable view component of my viewless package is this:

``` coffeescript
  @content: ->
    @div class: 'theme-screenshot', =>
```

Do I have to bind commands to view methods? My main action doesn't really do anything with the elements that the view is bound to. Shouldn't this be on the theme screenshot module directly? Am I thinking too much in terms of model-view here? Does the "view" basically encompass everything a package needs to do?

Is capturePage the same as node-webkit? (no, it provides a SlowBuffer, not a data uri) is it a chromium thing? why can't i find documentation on it anywhere? (ah, it's in atom-shell)

Hmm, how do I make sure my node deps will be installed with my package? do i have to just run npm install locally in the package dir as the dependencies change? Shouldn't atom in dev mode make sure the right stuff is installed?

Console seems to be hanging when I try to set breakpoints / pause on uncaught exceptions.

the first three bytes of the png buffer are incorrect, then the 4th byte is what the 2nd byte should be and the next 6 are the rest of the correct header. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1345 

Oh. It's not really a buffer, and I have to use `remote` to make it behave like a buffer. @zcbenz added this to the docs. Should it present itself as a node buffer if it's not really that? 

Now that I have clarification on some of these things, package development is pretty smooth. I wish I could require packages in the console though, or at least have access to jquery outside of packages.

---

That's it - if you're curious, the package so far is here: https://github.com/atom/theme-screenshot but it's really just a few lines of code at the moment, not exactly ready for prime time.

data.title: Help me out with capturePage and buffers
data.body:
Not sure if this belongs on atom/atom-shell or here. This is probably more of a story about my lack of understanding about encodings or the node fs api than any defects in software. I'd dig it if someone more versed with either or both would help me understand why I am seeing what I am seeing.

I spent a little bit of time this week playing around with package creation for the first time, as well as `capturePage()`. atom/feedback takes the buffer from `capturePage()` and calls `toString('base64')` on it and sends that to the GH API, which seems to work. As I was fiddling with rectangles to screencapture and so on I thought I'd write to a temp file rather than post every image. 

Unfortunately my code is writing corrupt pngs to the file system. The header of the file is almost right, and I can see IHDR and IEND so it's definitely a png, but the first byte (which should be a decimal 137) is replaced by `\ufffd` which is the UTF8 "replacement character", perhaps because it is greater than an signed hex digit can be?

I thought to try a few different encodings but according to the [doc for `fs.writeFile`](http://nodejs.org/api/fs.html#fs_fs_writefile_filename_data_options_callback) says the "encoding option is ignored if data is a buffer".

What am I doing wrong here? This is the extent of the code:

``` javascript
temp = require 'temp'
fs = require 'fs'
// 'temp' requirement can be avoided by providing an explicit path instead of info.path
temp.open 'screenie', (err, info) ->
  atom.getCurrentWindow().capturePage {x: 0, y: 0, width: 100, height: 100}, (buf) =>
    fs.writeFile info.path, buf, (err) ->
      console.error info.path
      console.error err
```

(The [test for capturePage](https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/blob/2945e1b50a626e95eedc08cb702aab377515f7e3/spec/api-browser-window-spec.coffee#L79) only tests that a buffer is returned, nothing about the buffer itself)

data.title: Scrollbars overlap soft wrapped text
data.body:
With soft wrapping turned on (either wrapping at the editor bounds or at my preferred line width), the scrollbars overlap a character or two of the text. Here's a gif to demonstrate:

![atom-softwrap.gif](http://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/113308/dnd/atom-softwrap.gif)

**About -> Atom** shows `Version 319f9a2 (319f9a2)`

The issue persists regardless of theme or font size.

data.title: Attempting to launch `atom` while it's updating should give me a nice message
data.body:
Saw an Atom update, closed Atom to get it. Relaunched Atom from the Terminal:

```
[master] ~/Development/ $ atom .
LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810.
```

I guess that means: "I'm still downloading! Be patient!" It'd be nice if the message clarified that a bit. Maybe with something relevant like "Fetching necessary valence electrons, please wait a moment." I'll leave the science jokes to you.

Somewhat related, I then had to hit `atom .` one more time to get it to open. I either shouldn't have to do this (_i.e._ Atom remembers there's a pending `atom` command and launches after it's done downloading), or, the release notes provides a button that says "download and restart."

data.title: Add the ability to cancel project.scan
data.body:
A search might need to be cancelled. This pull does 2 things
- When project scan is run again, any previous search is cancelled
- `Project::cancelScan()` function was added

data.body: I could not remember what the keyboard shortcut was to bring up the command palette or what the command palette was called.  My first thought was to look through the menus to find the keyboard shortcut… but the command palette doesn't exist as a menu item.

data.title: Fix mini editor leak
data.body:
Previously, we were overriding Editor::destroy, which is now provided
by telepath. Since the real destroy wasn't being called, we were failing
to remove editors associated with mini editor views.

data.title: Return windows specs to green
data.body:
Things have degraded since #1074 this branch will get us back on track.
## Specs to be fixed
- [ ] Core
- [x] Find and replace (atom/find-and-replace#114)
- [x] Link
- [x] Settings View
- [ ] Terminal

There are also a few other issues I'd like to solve here:
- [x] Fix error messages getting truncated in the output
- [x] Determine why atom-shell doesn't seem to cache on windows
- [x] Dig into spec parallelization issues

deserialize when the path has been deleted both on atom master and in
atom/atom#1326.

data.title: Run atom CI on windows
data.body: So this pull includes the necessary changes for running atom on windows.

data.title: Manage serialization of pane items with Telepath
data.body:
This PR is a first step toward fully telepathic panes. It's only goal is to remove manual serialization / deserialization of pane items and instead rely on Telepath to give us correctly deserialized objects directly in the document.
- [x] Core specs green and basic editors working
- [x] Make markdown preview serialize correctly
- [x] Convert state-backed pane items from packages to telepath models on master so they are forward-compatible with this PR
  - Settings view
  - Image Editor
  - Archive View
- [x] Verify that all pane item types serialize correctly

data.title: Remove movement menu
data.body: Were there any holdouts on removing the movement menu command?

data.title: Install apm outside of node_modules
data.body:
Allows apm to start referencing native module such as keytar.

`vendor/apm` now installs to `apm/node_modules` during `script/bootstrap` instead of to `node_modules/`.

data.title: Tab tooltips getting stuck
data.body:
I can't figure out what specifically I'm doing, but I keep getting these tooltips stuck and they won't go away.

/cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: Dont re-atomicize atomic tokens
data.body:
On soft-wrapped lines with hard tabs, it would convert the hard tabs to soft tabs when it split the tokens into multiple lines.

Fixes #1318

data.title: Regex find and replace with group and numbered backreference re-uses first line capture for all replacements
data.body:
For example, with the following document:

```
one 1
two 2
```

Executing the following find/replace:

```
Find: ^(\w+)\s(\d+)$
Replace: $2 $1
```

Results in the following document:

```
1 one
1 one
```

When it should produce the following:

```
1 one
2 two
```

data.title: Handle native commands in render process
data.body:
This gets copy, paste, etc. working again in elements with the `native-key-bindings` class.

This does duplicate some code with the browser process but that still needs to handle the first responder forwarding for the spec window and when the dev tools is focused.

Closes #1203

data.title: Need spinner for long delayed actions
data.body:
Today I did a regex find and replace on a 600 line document in which there were 600 matches. The action took approximately 8-10 seconds at which time Atom was completely locked up. While I'm a patient person, I did have a moment of "is it taking a while or has it crashed?". I'm not sure if it's possible but could we show a spinner for long actions like that?

Since the entire UI locked up, I'm guessing that we can't do it but I figured I'd mention it here.

data.body:
I'm trying to delete "Live! 360" but I can't. Selecting it and pressing delete only deletes the text that follows. Selecting it and then trying to type over it just adds text after. :crying_cat_face: 

![2013-12-16 11_59_23](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4356597/1757099/d8dd3b2e-667b-11e3-867b-7213675804ae.gif)

data.title: Incrementally load packages with activation events
data.body:
`activation events` are used to speed up window load time, slow packages aren't immediately loaded until a keybinding is pressed. But larger packages that take > 0.5 seconds to load (like [find and replace](https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/99) become unresponsive for a brief period of time. This could be fixed by ensuring every packages loads quickly, but this isn't realistic because packages created by other people will be out of our control. Another approach would be to intercept all events during package loading and then re-trigger the events after the package is loaded, but this will still feel sluggish and tightly couple the event code to jQuery.

This prototype pr works like this. If a package has activation events it will load as before, but Atom will also sequentially load these packages each tick. This activates all packages without having a noticeable effect on window load time. The worst case scenario is for a brief time (800ms i this case) the behavior in issue atom/find-and-replace#99 will still occur.

Here is the output of the logs

```
Window load time: 1500ms /Users/corey/github/atom/src/window-bootstrap.coffee:23
Delayed activation of to-the-hubs /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of symbols-view /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of package-generator /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of markdown-preview /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of go-to-line /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of github-sign-in /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of gists /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of find-and-replace /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of command-palette /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of autocomplete /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Delayed activation of autoflow /Users/corey/github/atom/src/atom-package.coffee:53
Total delayed activation time: 800.917ms 
```
